title: As03
author: As03
content: Hello everybody !First I would like to thank everyone here on this forum. I always have found people helping and being respectful so that's great !I've been interested in Bitcoin since 2019 and each year I learn new things and dig deeper in the rabbit hole.I run a full node since 2 years 24h/24h I run an avalon nano 3 miner since a few days for fun and you know... the very thin possibility to mine a bloc one day !I'd like to know how I could contribute more ? (I don't have dev skills so no coding for me)What are you doing yourself to help bitcoin grow ?Thank you.

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: Quote from: As03 on November 20, 2024, 09:18:35 AMI'd like to know how I could contribute more ? (I don't have dev skills so no coding for me)How about paying for goods or services you usually use with Bitcoin? VPN and email provider/account usually are easiest option to start, especially if you still use Google Mail and use internet without VPN or similar option.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Run a Lightning node and open a few channels and try to get people to route payments through you.Run a Bisq client and open a few offers.Operate a Nostr relay.Start an Electrum public server.Use your sats to donate to important projects that need funding.The possibilities are endless.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: As03 on November 20, 2024, 09:29:16 AMThank you for those ideas, I will begin research for making a lightning node/electrum server (I remember searching for Lnnode 2 years ago but it was a little complicated for me and I didn't finish it)It would be ideal if you try to find a specific purpose in everything, why you are doing it, not only because you want to make a contribution. Your contribution will be much more useful if you do something that will work even without your daily physical engagement.Over time, different problems always appear, direct or indirect. It is a greater contribution to solve such things than. I would say that the number of nodes is not the weakest point of the Bitcoin ecosystem.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: If you have any business you're running or managing, you can add Bitcoin as your second payment option. If you see someone that is interested in Bitcoin, you can also educate them more about the technology. Some person just know the word "Bitcoin" and nothing else.

comments.author: bitebits
comments.created_time: November 20, 2024, 01:05:04 PMLast edit: November 21, 2024, 06:06:13 PM by bitebits
comments.body: I'd say two things. To support privacy run a node over tor. And to encourage the use as a medium of exchange for small payments, run a lightning node. Especially, IMHO, the privacy part needs attention since it is the Achilles heel of BTC.https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com/questions/70069/how-can-i-setup-bitcoin-to-be-anonymous-with-torhttps://blog.bitfinex.com/trading/the-lightning-nodes-a-beginners-guide/

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Quote from: As03 on November 20, 2024, 09:18:35 AMWhat are you doing yourself to help bitcoin grow ?Thank you.Another way to help Bitcoin grow is by creating a public awareness or educating people about Bitcoin in your community, which can be done either directly or indirectly via the use of social media depending on government policies regarding Crypto in your geographical location, whereby you emphasize on creating a flyer about Bitcoin related key points such as; "importance of saving in Bitcoin", Why it's good to invest in Bitcoin, e.t.c. And there are several ways a public awareness can be made, as you can either create a blog dedicated to posting educative piece about Bitcoin/Crypto or create a YouTube channel where you teach people how to use Bitcoin related tools (e.g Wallets, exchange or projects).However, What I am doing myself to help bitcoin grow is by assisting and educating people who don't know about Bitcoin but wishes to invest in it to achieve their dreams. I also help people convert their Bitcoin into fiat currency (p2p).

comments.author: PrivacyG
comments.body: Use it.  It is the best thing you can do to help.  When ever you get a chance to use Bitcoin, do it.  Whether it is paying for a vacation booking in Bitcoin, paying for groceries, purchasing Gift Cards for your local shopping, paying your bills if possible et cetera, there are a lot of possibilities and the more people are using these payment processors or Services, the less likely it is that they give up on Bitcoin.  More over.  The more we are using it, the more likely it is that others will start accepting Bitcoin too because they would be missing on Customers and Profit.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: Quote from: As03 on November 20, 2024, 09:18:35 AMWhat are you doing yourself to help bitcoin grow ?I am a member of a small growing Bitcoin and crypto community. Our conversations on that platform is centered only on Bitcoin, it's technologies, as well as other cryptocurrency. We do admit new members to the community and it is like a snowball technique. That's how we help Bitcoin grow. On a personal note, I help Bitcoin grow by reposting Bitcoin related news, guides, and all things Bitcoin.

comments.author: MusaMohamed
comments.body: Quote from: Maslate on November 20, 2024, 11:55:31 AMI’m not sure if you’ll like the idea, but here in the forum, one of the best ways to grow your Bitcoin is by lending to trusted users.You might want to check out the Lending Board..Lending is risky and it's hard to trust users with their accounts as collateral for loans. Many trusted users, if trusted means green trust, with loans and they turned to be scammers.Bitcoin is scarce and if OP already has bitcoins, keep it safely. Contribute to Bitcoin adoption does not mean you need to take risk with your bitcoin and can lose it by taking risk.Running a Bitcoin full node, Lightning Network node, pay your purchases with bitcoins, donations in bitcoins, and more things, but I am more favorite with things I am ready to pay my bitcoin, not with taking risk and knowing that I can lose it to scammers.

(I don't have dev skills so no coding for me)What are you doing yourself to help bitcoin grow ?Thank you.Bitcoin on the technical side is decentralized, so this simply means that those who have the technical means and knowledge can contribute to the speed, stability and growth of the network, this is always open for any one interested, and as I can see, you have the technical means to a level, and you've taken a part, and maybe still taking a part in the development of the bitcoin network to the degree that you can, this is commendable.But for those who do not have the technical knowledge of means, or both, the only way to contribute is to buy and hold bitcoin, and you too, nothing stops your from buying and holding some bitcoins if you haven't, for the more the hands that holds bitcoin, the more it's adoption spread.

comments.author: franky1
comments.body: (i laugh when someone asks how to support bitcoin and replies try to promote another network(facepalm))running a lightning node is not about bitcoin. dont let people fool you. its a different network and a risky network, where many people lose their funds. (even lightning devs have lost their own funds using it, and they are suppose to be the experts)also if you dont have much funds then when you lock up your value and then allow others to route through you, because your balance is low your route wont be a optimum roue for many users and you may end up spending more of your value to re-balance yourself after people use you as a route.the small fee's do you get for offering your balance may not offer you profit compared to the cost to re-route your funds in another longer(expensive) path to rebalance your channel(s), or the cost to open and close the channel.. so do research and dont be lulled into some fake promotions where people pretend lightning is the better profitable networkthe lightning network does not help contribute to bitcoin. it infact is the agenda of causing people to use bitcoin less because they are being forced away from using bitcoin and instead told to use the lightning network. so dont be fooled by all the shenanigans of the subnetwork support group trying to promote another network as "bitcoin"

comments.author: retreat
comments.body: There are many things you can do to contribute to Bitcoin, the simplest thing is you can start investing in it and hold it in your wallet. Or you can spread the right education about Bitcoin to others and teach them how to invest their money in Bitcoin, or pay for your credit or internet package with Bitcoin. Simple things like that have really helped Bitcoin to grow in the future.
